ngiemboon: Pi metá puʼ, pi gwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò menkwɔɔn pí, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á zɛ́te ngie mé gÿo, ńne ńkímte ngie pi gí, pi gẅiin gẅi Tá fàʼ tÿǒ lepwó.
en: Masters,   deal with your slaves justly and fairly, since you know that you too have a Master in heaven.

ngiemboon: Pi ké ne ésẅíŋte Ssé sẅíŋte, tà pi lyé. Pi gwaa ne gÿo púʼu, ńne ńnáa ndǎg mbwó Ssé,
en: Devote yourselves   to prayer; stay alert in it with thanksgiving.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ne ésẅíŋte Ssé na ség twó, à ná shÿó mbwó peg lélɔg éshwóŋo nò yé. E fó púʼu, ńkyagte nò Keleto gie á la zɔɔn ńdyeen menÿɔ́g pʉ̀a lyeen. N gee ndátsǎŋ páʼɔɔn, ńtí pɔ́ yɛ̌.
en: At the same time, pray also for us that God may open a door   to us for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ,  # 4:3 1Co 2:7; Eph 3:4; 5:2 for which I am in chains,  # 4:3 Ac 27:2; 28:16,30; Eph 6:18–20

ngiemboon: Pi cwoŋo sẅíŋte Ssé, ńzsé ngie n ge shʉashʉa gɔɔn nò yé páʼ á ne ńzɛ́te ngie n gɔɔn.
en: so that I may make it known as I should.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na pʉ̀a pie é té pʉ̀a Keleto wɔ́, pi zsé ntí gie pi ge lɔg néŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b. E Ssé ná shʉa létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwó pɔ́b, tà pi cʉ́ʼ yɛ̌ fʉ̀ʼ tɔ́g.
en: Act wisely toward outsiders, making the most of the time.

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm ńgẅiin pɔ́ ncwò mbòŋo, ńgɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie á ge kẅéte, ńtsɔ́ʼɔ nò mbwó nyìŋ pɔ́ páʼ á kɔʼɔ́ ḿboŋ ngie mé tsɔ́ʼ.
en: Let your speech always be gracious, seasoned with salt,   so that you may know how you should answer each person.  # 4:6 1Pt 3:15

ngiemboon: Atʉ̀nzẅìŋ fɛ̌ wege Tishʉg, gẅie peg lâ pɔ̌ zɔ pǔ faʼa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge tó shwóŋo gẅí páʼ n gee jʉʼɔɔn ńnéŋe púʼu. Aa ngàŋafàʼ tɛʼ, à zsé pɔ́ nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Tychicus,   our dearly loved brother, faithful  # 4:7 Nm 23:19 minister, and fellow servant in the Lord, will tell you all the news about me.

ngiemboon: N cwoŋo ńtúmo yé páʼɔɔn ngie à gʉa shwóŋo gẅí páʼ peg lɔg ńnéŋe jʉʼɔɔn púʼu, mbɔɔ páʼ à ge tó kẅiŋte gẅí.
en: I have sent him to you for this very purpose, so that you may know how we are   and so that he may encourage  # 4:8 Lk 16:25 your hearts.  # 4:8 Eph 6:21–22; Col 2:2

ngiemboon: Tishʉg pɔ́ Onezim ge gÿo pú tó. Onezim aa tsɔ̌ tàʼ nyìŋ gẅi, ńgwɔ́ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ fɛ̌ wege, ńzsé yé pɔ́ ndàʼ nò Yěsô. Pɔ́ ge tó, éshwóŋo gẅí kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ne ńcʉate jʉʼɔɔn.
en: He is coming with Onesimus,   a faithful and dearly loved brother, who is one of you. They will tell you about everything here.

ngiemboon: Alisetag gẅie peg yé pǔ ńgwɔ́ ndátsǎŋ, à tsyɛʼté gẅí. Málákúsè gẅie aa míŋ fɛ̌ Panébásè giŋé ńtsyɛʼte gẅí yé. N ka zɔɔn ńkíme yé mbwó pi. À lɔɔn ńkúu jʉʼɛ, pi kúe yé mboŋó.
en: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, sends you greetings, as does Mark,   Barnabas’s  # 4:10 Ac 4:36 cousin (concerning whom you have received instructions: if he comes to you, welcome him),

ngiemboon: Yěsô gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo yé lê Jẅisetẅísè tsyɛʼté gẅí yé. Á gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pà Yúndà pie é ka zẅíŋe nò Keleto, ée ndàʼ wɔ́b pɔɔn métá pie peg lâ pɔ̌ ee jʉʼɔɔn, éfaʼa ńtí nò lefùɔ Ssé. Pɔ́ zɔ̌ ka ne ńnéŋe ntʉ́m wɔ́ɔn.
en: and so does Jesus who is called Justus. These alone of the circumcised are my coworkers for the kingdom of God, and they have been a comfort to me.

ngiemboon: Epafalásè gẅie aa nyìŋ láʼ gẅi, à tsyɛʼté gẅí. Wɔɔn aa nyìŋ gẅie à faʼa fàʼ Keleto, ńnéŋe fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm, ńne ńdɔgɔ lésẅíŋte Ssé, ḿmaʼa ncù na twó sí. À gÿo púʼu, légwɔ́ gie pi ge tʉ tʉ na nò Yěsô, atsɔ́ mmó le gíŋe ńzága na pi wɔ́, pi néŋe fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm, ńzẅíŋ pɔ́ légÿo mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi gÿo.
en: Epaphras,   who is one of you, a servant of Christ Jesus, sends you greetings. He is always wrestling  # 4:12 Jd 3 for you in his prayers, so that you can stand mature and fully assured  # 4:12 Other mss read and complete in everything God wills.  # 4:12 Gl 1:4; Eph 1:9

ngiemboon: N dɔ̌g nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn ńgyá páʼ à gyá ngɔ́ʼ, éfaʼa ńtí gẅí, éfaʼa ńtí mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Ssé pie ée Lawondise mbɔɔ pie ée Hilapolísè.
en: For I testify about him that he works hard  ,# 4:13 Jd 3 for you, for those in Laodicea,  # 4:13 Col 2:1 and for those in Hierapolis.

ngiemboon: Ashǔ wege Lúkáasè, á lɔ́gtà lÿò, mbɔɔ Ndemásè, pɔ́ tsyɛʼté gẅí.
en: Luke, the dearly loved physician, and Demas   send you greetings.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛʼte mefɛ̌ mefɛ̌ pie ée Lawondise, ńtsyɛʼte Nimfa mbɔɔ cúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto gie áa ndá yé.
en: Give my greetings to the brothers and sisters in Laodicea, and to Nympha and the church in her home.

ngiemboon: Pi ge tóŋo yɔɔn ŋwàʼne tà à mag, é faʼ shÿó, é túm náa mbwó cúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto gie áa Lawondise, pɔ́ tóŋ yɔ́b. Ayɔ́b ŋwàʼne gie n tǔm, pɔ́ ná pi gíŋe ńtóŋ gí.
en: After this letter has been read at your gathering, have it read also in the church of the Laodiceans; and see that you also read the letter from Laodicea.

ngiemboon: Pi gɔɔn mbwó Aleshʉ́pè ngie, tà á lɔgɔ fàʼ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka cʉ́me mbwó yé, ńdɔg ńgÿo megʉa, ngie à faʼ mboŋó.
en: And tell Archippus,   “Pay attention to the ministry you have received in the Lord, so that you can accomplish it.”  # 4:17 2Tm 4:5

ngiemboon: Pi gyá tsyɛʼte gie mèŋ Pɔ̂ɔ n dɔgɔ kwàʼ pwó yɔ́ɔn ńŋwéʼe. Tà pi lege ngie mèŋ n gee ndátsǎŋ.
en: I, Paul, am writing this greeting with my own hand. Remember my chains.   Grace be with you.  # 4:18 Other mss add Amen.,# 4:18 1Tm 6:21; 2Tm 4:22; Ti 3:15
